article.headline: Davidson 70, Nebraska 67
article.story: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico -- Brendan McKillop scored 21 points, Jake Cohen had 19 and Davidson beat Nebraska 70-67 Friday in the Puerto Rico Tip-Off. McKillop hit six 3-pointers to lead a complete long-range turnaround for the Wildcats (1-2). A day after a 2-for-22 effort in a loss to West Virginia, Davidson made 11 of 28 3s. The Huskers (2-2) blew a chance to tie when Brandon Ubel was whistled for traveling with 15.6 seconds left. Eshaunte Jones missed a tying 3 and Davidson held on from the free-throw line. Lance Jeter scored 18 points and Christian Standhardinger had 14 points for Nebraska. The Wildcats hit three straight 3s early in the second half, but could not get a lead larger than two points off any of them. McKillop, who made 6 of 11 3-pointers, changed that when he hit consecutive 3-pointers for a 46-40 lead. McKillop kept the 3-point happy offense rolling with another that gave them a nine-point lead. Nebraska, which has dropped both games in the tournament, would get the game within one. Jorge Brian Diaz, the only player from Puerto Rico in the eight-team field, made a layup for a 58-56 lead and Jeter's jumper cut it to 63-62. Diaz scored 13 points. The Huskers had funky numbers in each half: Nebraska shot 32 percent in the first 20 minutes and led 30-28; then went 12 of 19 from the field in the second and were outscored by five points. Nebraska even won the battle from the free-throw line, making more shots (23) than Davidson attempted (20). The difference was at the 3-point line. Jeter made the only two 3s for the Huskers. Cohen, who scored 15 points in the first half, hit two for Davidson and De'Mon Brooks also made two. Brooks hit a big one late as part of his 11 points after Diaz's layup made it one-point game and gave the Wildcats just enough room to keep the lead the rest of the way. Nebraska's Drake Beranek made two free throws with 29 seconds left to make it 65-64. Ubel, who had nine rebounds, was called for the crucial travel and a desperation shot was off the mark. Each team has one more game in the three-day tournament on Sunday.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
